Description: The balance sheet equation represents the basic accounting identity.
Net income is the total profit after subtracting all expenses.
Use Case Example: If revenue is $10,000 and expenses are $7,000, net income = $10,000 - $7,000.

Description: Gross profit margin measures the percentage of revenue that exceeds the cost of goods sold.
Use Case Example: If revenue is $15,000 and COGS is $9,000, margin = (15,000 - 9,000) / 15,000.

Description: ROA measures how effectively a company uses its assets to generate profit.
